segment.source: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database
segment.target: How to install the Management Server on a Standalone Computer and Connect it to the Database

segment.source: Use the following procedure to install the management server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to install the management server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database.

segment.source: To install the management server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database
segment.target: To install the management server on a standalone computer and connect it to the database

segment.source: Copy the App-V 5.0 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it on.
segment.target: Copy the App-V 5.0 server installation files to the computer on which you want to install it on.

segment.source: To start the App-V 5.0 server installation right-click and run appvserversetup.exe as an administrator.
segment.target: To start the App-V 5.0 server installation right-click and run appvserversetup.exe as an administrator.

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: On the Getting Started page, review and accept the license terms, and click Next.
segment.target: On the Getting Started page, review and accept the license terms, and click Next.

segment.source: On the Use Microsoft Update to help keep your computer secure and up-to-date page, to enable Microsoft updates, select Use Microsoft Update when I check for updates (recommended).
segment.target: On the Use Microsoft Update to help keep your computer secure and up-to-date page, to enable Microsoft updates, select Use Microsoft Update when I check for updates (recommended).

segment.source: To disable Microsoft updates, select I don’t want to use Microsoft Update.
segment.target: To disable Microsoft updates, select I don’t want to use Microsoft Update.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Feature Selection page, select the Management Server checkbox and click Next.
segment.target: On the Feature Selection page, select the Management Server checkbox and click Next.

segment.source: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location and click Next.
segment.target: On the Installation Location page, accept the default location and click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Existing Management Database page, select Use a remote SQL Server, and type the machine name of the computer running Microsoft SQL SQL, for example SqlServerMachine.
segment.target: On the Configure Existing Management Database page, select Use a remote SQL Server, and type the machine name of the computer running Microsoft SQL SQL, for example SqlServerMachine.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Microsoft SQL Server is deployed on the same server, select Use local SQL Server.
segment.target: If the Microsoft SQL Server is deployed on the same server, select Use local SQL Server.

segment.source: For the SQL Server Instance, select Use the default instance.
segment.target: For the SQL Server Instance, select Use the default instance.

segment.source: If you are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance, you must select Use a custom instance and then type the name of the instance.
segment.target: If you are using a custom Microsoft SQL Server instance, you must select Use a custom instance and then type the name of the instance.

segment.source: Specify the SQL Server Database name that this management server will use, for example AppvManagement.
segment.target: Specify the SQL Server Database name that this management server will use, for example AppvManagement.

segment.source: On the Configure Management Server Configuration page, specify the AD group or account that will connect to the management console for administrative purposes for example MyDomainMyUser or MyDomainAdminGroup.
segment.target: On the Configure Management Server Configuration page, specify the AD group or account that will connect to the management console for administrative purposes for example MyDomainMyUser or MyDomainAdminGroup.

segment.source: The account or AD group you specify will be enabled to manage the server through the management console.
segment.target: The account or AD group you specify will be enabled to manage the server through the management console.

segment.source: You can add additional users or groups using the management console after installation
segment.target: You can add additional users or groups using the management console after installation

segment.source: Specify the Website Name that you want to use for the management service.
segment.target: Specify the Website Name that you want to use for the management service.

segment.source: Accept the default if you do not have a custom name.
segment.target: Accept the default if you do not have a custom name.

segment.source: For the Port Binding, specify a unique port number to be used, for example 12345.
segment.target: For the Port Binding, specify a unique port number to be used, for example 12345.

segment.source: Click Install.
segment.target: Click Install.

segment.source: To confirm that the setup has completed successfully, open a web browser, and type the following URL: http://managementserver:portnumber/Console.html if the installation was successful you should see the Silverlight Management Console appear without any error messages or warnings being displayed.
segment.target: To confirm that the setup has completed successfully, open a web browser, and type the following URL: http://managementserver:portnumber/Console.html if the installation was successful you should see the Silverlight Management Console appear without any error messages or warnings being displayed.
